episodes.title: The Sopranos
episodes.description: Tony Soprano, a mob boss, seeks therapy with Dr. Jennifer Melfi after suffering from panic attacks, while dealing with mob-related issues and family conflicts.

episodes.title: 46 Long
episodes.description: Tony's crew engages in various activities, including collecting debts and discussing the growing drug problem in their territory.

episodes.title: Denial, Anger, Acceptance
episodes.description: Tony's mother, Livia, influences Junior Soprano to challenge Tony's leadership, causing tension within the family.

episodes.title: Meadowlands
episodes.description: Tony's concerns over his mother's intentions grow as he juggles his personal life with the demands of his mob duties.

episodes.title: College
episodes.description: Tony takes Meadow on a college visit while handling a hit job, leading to a moral dilemma during the trip.

episodes.title: Pax Soprana
episodes.description: Tony's attempts to enjoy a peaceful family dinner are interrupted by mob business, leading to further complications.

episodes.title: Down Neck
episodes.description: Flashbacks shed light on Tony's childhood while present-day struggles with his son highlight the challenges of parenthood.

episodes.title: The Legend of Tennessee Moltisanti
episodes.description: Christopher's aspirations to become a made man lead to tension within the crew, while Tony deals with family matters.

episodes.title: Boca
episodes.description: Tony's affair with a friend's wife causes complications, while Junior faces consequences for his actions.

episodes.title: A Hit Is a Hit
episodes.description: Tony's attempt to manage a rapper's career intersects with mob business, leading to unforeseen consequences.

episodes.title: Nobody Knows Anything
episodes.description: Tony faces a crisis when Pussy disappears, leading to suspicions and paranoia within the crew.

episodes.title: Isabella
episodes.description: Tony's mental state deteriorates as he grapples with stress, leading to a hallucinatory encounter.

episodes.title: I Dream of Jeannie Cusamano
episodes.description: Tony's suspicions about those closest to him come to a head, leading to a dramatic confrontation and a shocking revelation.

episodes.title: Guy Walks into a Psychiatrist's Office...
episodes.description: After therapy, Tony Soprano feels depressed over the negative impact it could have on his children.

episodes.title: Do Not Resuscitate
episodes.description: Tony and Meadow clash over her life choices, while Uncle Junior and Tony spar over how to handle their business.

episodes.title: Toodle-Fucking-Oo
episodes.description: Tony is caught off guard by a surprise reunion with his estranged sister, Janice.

episodes.title: Commendatori
episodes.description: Tony and Paulie travel to Italy on a business trip that turns into a personal odyssey.

episodes.title: Big Girls Don't Cry
episodes.description: Christopher and Adriana take drastic measures when her fear of marriage threatens to send him back to his old ways.

episodes.title: The Happy Wanderer
episodes.description: Richie Aprile gets out after ten years in prison and starts reasserting his authority.

episodes.title: D-Girl
episodes.description: Chris becomes a made man, while Tony experiences another panic attack.

episodes.title: Full Leather Jacket
episodes.description: Richie tries to involve Tony in a questionable deal.

episodes.title: From Where to Eternity
episodes.description: Christopher has an out-of-body experience during an operation and he has no recollection of it later.

episodes.title: Bust Out
episodes.description: Tony and his family have to stay in hiding until Phil Leotardo is dealt with.

episodes.title: House Arrest
episodes.description: Tony's newfound happiness is threatened when Paulie and Christopher cause a rift between him and Pussy.

episodes.title: The Knight in White Satin Armor
episodes.description: Ralph's callous behavior finally steps over the line, while Chris gets deeper into his heroin addiction.

episodes.title: Funhouse
episodes.description: Tony starts having flashbacks about Pussy's betrayal, and Livia becomes increasingly paranoid.

episodes.title: Mr. Ruggerio's Neighborhood
episodes.description: The FBI finds a new informant, and Carmela starts demanding more respect.

episodes.title: Proshai, Livushka
episodes.description: Tony is on the verge of tears, while Junior is harassed as he begins to think about his future.

episodes.title: Fortunate Son
episodes.description: Christopher is in debt to Tony for providing him with a new life, while Tony is anxious about his future.

episodes.title: Employee of the Month
episodes.description: Carmela suggests that her father-in-law invest in her cousin's film project, while Tony and his crew have a new source of income.

episodes.title: Another Toothpick
episodes.description: Richie's temper continues to cause problems for Tony, while Tony is caught off guard by a surprise visit from his father.

episodes.title: University
episodes.description: Meadow spends time with Jackie Jr., while Carmela's request that Tony spend more time with AJ backfires.

episodes.title: Second Opinion
episodes.description: Tony's increasingly stressful home life leads him to seek psychiatric counseling, while Richie's relationship with Janice causes concern for Junior.

episodes.title: He Is Risen
episodes.description: Tony becomes more paranoid and skeptical, while Junior's trial looks bleak.

episodes.title: The Telltale Moozadell
episodes.description: Christopher's addiction to heroin continues to spiral out of control, while Tony begins to wonder if he made the right decision regarding Janice.

episodes.title: ...To Save Us All from Satan's Power
episodes.description: The Sopranos try to relax in the days leading up to Christmas, while Janice visits with her new boyfriend.

episodes.title: Pine Barrens
episodes.description: Christopher and Paulie are stuck in the woods after a hunting trip goes wrong.

episodes.title: Amour Fou
episodes.description: Carmela's romantic interest in Furio grows, while Tony's behavior becomes increasingly erratic.

episodes.title: Army of One
episodes.description: Tony's stress leads to a panic attack, while Carmela grows increasingly concerned about Furio.

episodes.title: For All Debts Public and Private
episodes.description: Tony reflects on life while recovering from his gunshot wounds, while Junior adjusts to life under house arrest.

episodes.title: No Show
episodes.description: Christopher's drug use continues to spiral out of control, while Tony tries to find a missing VCR player.

episodes.title: Christopher
episodes.description: Tony's concern over his cousin's behavior grows, while Carmela considers investing in her father's business.

episodes.title: The Weight
episodes.description: Tony confronts a mysterious man, while Carmela faces pressure to accept a lucrative offer.

episodes.title: Pie-O-My
episodes.description: Tony becomes fascinated with a racehorse named Pie-O-My, while Ralph's behavior becomes increasingly erratic.

episodes.title: Everybody Hurts
episodes.description: The death of a close friend forces Tony to confront his own mortality, while Paulie seeks revenge for an insult.

episodes.title: Watching Too Much Television
episodes.description: Tony faces questions about his relationship with Gloria, while Carmela tries to keep AJ out of trouble.

episodes.title: Mergers and Acquisitions
episodes.description: Ralph's behavior becomes increasingly disturbing, while Tony tries to broker a peace agreement.

episodes.title: Whoever Did This
episodes.description: Tony deals with the fallout from Ralph's actions, while Christopher's addiction continues to spiral out of control.

episodes.title: The Strong, Silent Type
episodes.description: Tony becomes suspicious of his family's loyalty, while Carmela faces pressure from her father.

episodes.title: Calling All Cars
episodes.description: Tony tries to secure his future while dealing with a betrayal, while Carmela seeks refuge at Furio's house.

episodes.title: Eloise
episodes.description: Tony faces a tough decision regarding Ralph's fate, while Christopher tries to make a fresh start.

episodes.title: Whitecaps
episodes.description: Tony and Carmela's marriage reaches a breaking point, while Tony tries to salvage his business dealings.

episodes.title: Two Tonys
episodes.description: Tony struggles to balance his family life with his responsibilities as a mob boss, while Carmela seeks solace in therapy.

episodes.title: Rat Pack
episodes.description: Tony faces questions about his leadership, while Carmela takes steps to secure her financial future.

episodes.title: Where's Johnny?
episodes.description: Tony tries to keep his business dealings under wraps, while Carmela becomes increasingly concerned about her safety.

episodes.title: All Happy Families...
episodes.description: Tony deals with the fallout from Ralph's actions, while Carmela struggles with her feelings for Furio.

episodes.title: Irregular Around the Margins
episodes.description: Tony's relationship with Gloria continues to spiral out of control, while Carmela seeks solace in religion.

episodes.title: Sentimental Education
episodes.description: Tony's affair with Gloria takes a dangerous turn, while Carmela tries to improve her financial situation.

episodes.title: In Camelot
episodes.description: Tony tries to secure his future while dealing with a betrayal, while Carmela seeks refuge at Furio's house.

episodes.title: Marco Polo
episodes.description: Tony faces questions about his leadership, while Carmela takes steps to secure her financial future.

episodes.title: Unidentified Black Males
episodes.description: Tony deals with the fallout from Ralph's actions, while Carmela struggles with her feelings for Furio.

episodes.title: Cold Cuts
episodes.description: Tony faces questions about his leadership, while Carmela takes steps to secure her financial future.

episodes.title: The Test Dream
episodes.description: Tony has a series of unsettling dreams, while Carmela seeks comfort in her newfound independence.

episodes.title: Long Term Parking
episodes.description: Adriana's involvement with the FBI comes to a head, while Tony tries to maintain control over his empire.

episodes.title: All Due Respect
episodes.writer: David Chase & Robin Green & Mitchell Burgess
episodes.description: Tony faces tough decisions about his future, while Carmela tries to protect her family from harm.
